title: Trying to finish Alber
content:
Hi all,

I would really appreciate any feedback or general crit on [Alber](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123124735/http:/homepage.ntlworld.com/c.dickinson40/Alber.pdf) ,a sans I'm trying to finish.

Thanks in advance.

s.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Alber v2.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123124735/http:/typophile.com/files/Alber%20v2.pdf) | 88.01 KB |
| [Alber v3.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123124735/http:/typophile.com/files/Alber%20v3.pdf) | 89.89 KB |
| [Alber.v4.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123124735/http:/typophile.com/files/Alber.v4.pdf) | 89.03 KB |
| [Alberv5.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123124735/http:/typophile.com/files/Alberv5.pdf) | 132.05 KB |
author: coop

comments.content:
That's strange, it seems to be working for me

It on a friends server so I'll look into it.

No, I see it - I meant no reaction from Typophiles?

hhp

Quite a fine job. S/s/$ seem to all be leaning a bit to the right. The stem of the 7 may be too thin at the top. That's about all I could spot. Getting into the realm of personal taste, I might question the shear on the upper left corner of the u.

cerulean

Thanks for the response, I'll try some alterations and re-post.

s

the stress on the 'y' seems to be on the wrong stroke  
Really like what's goin on here

aaron

aaron,

Thanks for the comment, I was going to post an updated version today, I'll look at the 'y' with your comment in mind.

s

Where is the sample to crit? I don't see a file.

ChrisL

That's because the link highlight color on Typophile  
is another symptom of graphic-designer-too-subtlitis.

Click on "Alber" in the first post.

hhp
I've added an updated version to the first post
Another update to Alber with altered accents and added Eth, Thorn etc.

I've added another updated version of Alber to the first post.  
I would really appreciate any feedback, crit, approval or disapproval  
Have I got this completely wrong or is it not original enough.

I'm having a hard time with the bold. It looks a little too 'auto bold'. I'd like to see the joins have a little more contrast. That being said, this is more of an aesthetic opinion than a technical problem with the font. Over all It's a pretty polished piece of work, though.

Christian,

thanks for your comments, I've added the italics to the first post - love to hear what people think. The italics still need work with the spacing etc.
